citations.narrative:
The facility is not removing and replacing litter in the outdoor rabbit enclosure weekly. According to the licensee, the
outdoor rabbit enclosure has the litter completely removed and replaced approximately once a month. Failure to remove
soiled litter and bedding in rabbit enclosures frequently enough leads to an accumulation of waste and debris that can
expose the animals to unnecessary disease risks and attract pests. Correct by March 12, 2024 by ensuring that all litter in
rabbit enclosures with solid flooring is completely removed and replaced at least once a week.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.56(a)(2) 
   
Sanitation. 
The facility is not removing and replacing litter in the outdoor rabbit enclosure weekly. According to the licensee, the 
outdoor rabbit enclosure has the litter completely removed and replaced approximately once a month. Failure to remove 
soiled litter and bedding in rabbit enclosures frequently enough leads to an accumulation of waste and debris that can 
expose the animals to unnecessary disease risks and attract pests. Correct by March 12, 2024 by ensuring that all litter in 
rabbit enclosures with solid flooring is completely removed and replaced at least once a week. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
